availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Issac Newton Webb. (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Levia Ann Gist Webb. Father to John G. Webb, Thirmutus Ann Webb, Sallie Webb, Mary Webb Barbour, Issac Newton Webb Jr., Waller Y. Webb, and Washington Irving Webb. Owned fifteen enslaved individuals in Henry County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District 1, p. 364A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 328.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision 1, p. 19.
Find A Grave, "Issac Newton Webb (May 25, 1817-Dec. 3, 1882)," Memorial #86134171, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/86134171 (accessed March 24, 2020).
